fast3d.renderables

Class Line

  • java.lang.Object
    • fast3d.renderables.Line
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Renderable

    public class Line
extends java.lang.Object
implements Renderable
    a line in 3d space with width of 1 pixel
    lines disappear on mathematically correct ray-tracing imaging, because they have no actual width (like when using the DefaultFragmentShader)
    Author:
    Tim Trense

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Vector3d a
      the starting point of the line
      Vector3d b
      the ending point of the line
      static double defaultRayIntersectionZeroLockControl
      determines the default value for the rayIntersectionZeroLockControl on instancing a line
      double rayIntersectionZeroLockControl
      on ray-intersection-computing (ray tracing) it is normally impossible to target a mathematical line (with actual no width) using rastered rays like when displaying an universe to any computer screen

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Line(Vector3d a, Vector3d b)
      constructs a line from start to end with a white color
      Line(Vector3d a, Vector3d b, Color c)
      constructs a line from start to end with the color c

      should return every vertex used during render() to accelerate the shading and rendering
      a renderable is requested to return all its vertices here

      Vector3d rayTrace(Vector3d s, Vector3d r)
      for 3d-clicks on a panel3d or some lighting/shadowing calculation it is important to determine whether a renderable has some puncture point with a ray

      rotates the line around the constant z axis
      void shade(Graphics3d s)
      called when this renderable is requested to calculate where to draw on screen
      the graphics-context is not clipped, so it is greatly needed to really just draw itself

      • shade

        public void shade(Graphics3d s)
        Description copied from interface: Renderable
        called when this renderable is requested to calculate where to draw on screen
        the graphics-context is not clipped, so it is greatly needed to really just draw itself
        during this method is is highly recommended to not draw anything
        Specified by:
        shade in interface Renderable
        Parameters:
        s - the 3d-graphics-context to do calculations, not null

      • render

        public void moveTo(Vector3d target)
